text: vivo is launching the X200 Ultra and X200s on April 21, and the two phones will be joined by two tablets: the high-end Pad5 Pro and the mid-range Pad SE. vivo has already confirmed some of their specs, and today we get a full list of specs for both courtesy of a leaker over on Weibo. The vivo Pad5 Pro is thus allegedly going to come with a 13" "3.1K" 3:2 screen with 144 Hz refresh rate and 1,200-nit peak brightness, the MediaTek Dimensity 9400 SoC at the helm (interestingly, not the recently unveiled Dimensity 9400+), up to 16GB of RAM, and up to 512GB of storage. It will have eight speakers and a 12,050 mAh battery with support for 66W fast wired charging. It will have two versions, the standard one weighing 635g and an ultra-light iteration weighing just 578g and being 5.94mm thin. It will be offered in blue, gray, pink, and white. The Pad SE on the other hand will have a 12.3" "2.5K" 3:2 screen with 90 Hz refresh rate, the Snapdragon 4 Gen 2 SoC at the helm, up to 8GB of RAM and up to 256GB of storage, and four speakers. Keeping the lights on will be an 8,500 mAh battery with support for 15W wired charging. This one will be offered in blue, Titanium, and gray, once again in two versions: one with 6.87mm thickness and 569g weight, the other with 6.8mm thickness and 559g weight. html:
vivo is launching the X200 Ultra and X200s on April 21, and the two phones will be joined by two tablets: the high-end Pad5 Pro and the mid-range Pad SE. vivo has already confirmed some of their specs, and today we get a full list of specs for both courtesy of a leaker over on Weibo.

The vivo Pad5 Pro is thus allegedly going to come with a 13" "3.1K" 3:2 screen with 144 Hz refresh rate and 1,200-nit peak brightness, the MediaTek Dimensity 9400 SoC at the helm (interestingly, not the recently unveiled Dimensity 9400+), up to 16GB of RAM, and up to 512GB of storage.

It will have eight speakers and a 12,050 mAh battery with support for 66W fast wired charging. It will have two versions, the standard one weighing 635g and an ultra-light iteration weighing just 578g and being 5.94mm thin. It will be offered in blue, gray, pink, and white.

The Pad SE on the other hand will have a 12.3" "2.5K" 3:2 screen with 90 Hz refresh rate, the Snapdragon 4 Gen 2 SoC at the helm, up to 8GB of RAM and up to 256GB of storage, and four speakers. Keeping the lights on will be an 8,500 mAh battery with support for 15W wired charging. This one will be offered in blue, Titanium, and gray, once again in two versions: one with 6.87mm thickness and 569g weight, the other with 6.8mm thickness and 559g weight.
